hypothesis_content.title: Negative News Catalyst Amplification in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes (confidence >55%), negative BTC news headlines containing specific fear-trigger keywords ('plummeted', 'liquidations', 'scarier', 'downside possible') will amplify selling pressure beyond the initial 1-hour reaction, creating a predictable 4-6 hour continuation pattern that can be shorted.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack strong directional conviction, making them susceptible to news-driven sentiment shifts. Recent 'scary macro catalyst' narratives combined with technical breakdowns create self-reinforcing selling as weak hands exit and algorithmic systems detect momentum.
entry_conditions: BTC negative news headline detected with ≥2 fear keywords from predefined list
Volume spike ≥ 150% of 20-day average in first hour

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC 4-hour return reaches -3.5% from entry price
exit_conditions.time_exit: 6 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 4-hour return after negative news in neutral regimes is ≥ -1.0% (statistically insignificant continuation)
